SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.robix.nexway
Class ScriptingInfo

java.lang.Object
  com.robix.nexway.ScriptingInfo
public class ScriptingInfo
extends java.lang.Object

Helper class which contains a snapshot of a Pod's scripting information.

If you want to monitor a Pod's scripting status, it is helpful to get a ScriptingInfo snapshot from the Pod, and then re-submit the same ScriptingInfo object in order to determine what items have changed. 

 ScriptingInfo si = pod.getScriptingInfo();

 System.out.println( "Pod's main script name: " + si.getMainScriptName() );

 ...

 // refresh scripting info
 pod.getScriptingInfo( si );

 // check for changes
 if ( si.mainScriptChanged() )
 {
    System.out.println( "Pod's main script has changed. New name: " + si.getMainScriptName() );
 }
You can use the Usbor Nexway application to see how a Pod's scripting information changes. The "Pod Event Log" panel is very helpful in this regard. The Pod Event panel is not visible by default, so you'll have to add it to your PodGui. Right-click on the main scripting panel and select: Split This Panel -> Down. Then right-click on the new empty panel and select: Replace With -> Pod Event Log. Now when you execute scripts, you'll see a log of events as they occur.

See Also:
Pod.getScriptingInfo()

Constructor Detail

ScriptingInfo

protected ScriptingInfo()
Method Detail

createCopy

public ScriptingInfo createCopy()
Creates a new scripting info object which contains the same scripting information as this object. The new object will be updatable, even if the original object was not.

Since:
1.0.0

scriptingInfoChanged

public boolean scriptingInfoChanged()
Determines if any of the scripting info has changed. If this method returns false, then all of the other xxxChanged() methods will also return false. If this method returns true, then at least one of the other xxxChanged() methods will return true.

Returns:
true if something has changed; false otherwise
Since:
1.0.0

actionChanged

public boolean actionChanged()
Determines if Pod action has changed.

Returns:
true if Pod action has changed; false otherwise

public int getAction()
Returns the Pod's action.

Returns:
the Pod's PodAction

public boolean mainScriptChanged()
Determines if main script info has changed.

Returns:

public java.lang.String getMainScriptText()
Returns the text of the Pod's main script.

Returns:
main script text

getMainScriptName

public java.lang.String getMainScriptName()
Returns the name of the Pod's main script.

Returns:
main script name

getMainScriptMod

public int getMainScriptMod()
Returns the modification number of the Pod's main script. This number is incremented whenever the Pod's main script is changed.

Returns:
the main script's mod number

getMainScriptRep

public java.lang.String getMainScriptRep()
Returns the name of the Rep which assigned the main script to the Pod.

Rep names are useful for determining the "owner" or "source" of a script when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually do not need to worry about rep names.

Returns:
the main script's Rep

getMainScriptSeq

public int getMainScriptSeq()
Returns the sequence number of the Pod's main script.

This number is bound to the script during a call to Pod.assignMainScript(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)or Pod.assignMainScriptFromFile(java.lang.String). A script's sequence number is useful for tracking scripts when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually do not need to worry about script sequence numbers.

Returns:
the main script's sequence number

public boolean quickScriptChanged()
Determines if quick script info has changed.

Returns:
true if quick script info has changed; false otherwise

quick script text

Returns:
quick script name

getQuickScriptMod

public int getQuickScriptMod()
Returns the modification number of the Pod's quick script. This number is incremented whenever the Pod's quick script is changed.

Returns:
the main script's mod number

getQuickScriptRep

public java.lang.String getQuickScriptRep()
Returns the name of the Rep which executed the Pod's quick script.

Rep names are useful for determining the "owner" or "source" of a script when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually do not need to worry about rep names.

Returns:
the quick script's Rep

getQuickScriptSeq

public int getQuickScriptSeq()
Returns the sequence number of the Pod's quick script.

This number is bound to the script during a call to Pod.runQuickScript(java.lang.String,java.lang.String). A script's sequence number is useful for tracking scripts when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually do not need to worry about script sequence numbers.

Returns:
the quick script's sequence number

currCmdChanged

public boolean currCmdChanged()
Determines if script command (current command) info has changed. Examples of script commands include, "move all to maxpos", "wait 10", etc. A Pod's script command info will change as each command is executed.

Returns:
true if script command info has changed; false otherwise

getCurrCmdIsInQuick

public boolean getCurrCmdIsInQuick()
Determines if the current command info refers to a quick script.

This property is valid only when the Pod's action is PodAction.WORKING.

Returns:
true if current command info applies to the Pod's quick script; false if current command info applies to the Pod's main script

getCurrCmdStartPos

public int getCurrCmdStartPos()
Returns the starting position of the currently-executing command within the script.

This property is valid only when the Pod's action is PodAction.WORKING.

Returns:
zero-based offset of the current command

getCurrCmdEndPos

public int getCurrCmdEndPos()
Returns the end position of the currently-executing command within the script.

This property is valid only when the Pod's action is PodAction.WORKING.

Returns:
zero-based offset of the end of current command

getCurrCmdLine

public int getCurrCmdLine()
Returns the line of the currently-executing command within the script.

This property is valid only when the Pod's action is PodAction.WORKING.

Returns:
zero-based line of the current command

getCurrCmdColumn

public int getCurrCmdColumn()
Returns the column of the currently-executing command within the script.

This property is valid only when the Pod's action is PodAction.WORKING.

Returns:
zero-based column of the current command

Determines if wait count has changed.

Returns:
true if wait count has changed; false otherwise

Determines if the error occurred while executing a quick script.

Returns:
true if error occurred in quick script; false if error occurred in main script

getErrorScriptMod

public int getErrorScriptMod()
Returns the mod of the script in which the error occurred.

Returns:
the script mod

getErrorRep

public java.lang.String getErrorRep()
Returns the name of the Rep that executed the Pod command which caused the scripting error.

Rep names are useful for determining the "owner" or "source" of a script/command when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually do not need to worry about rep names.

Returns:
the Rep of the Pod command that caused the error
Since:
1.0.0

getErrorSeq

public int getErrorSeq()
Returns the sequence number of the Pod command which caused the scripting error.

Sequence numbers (aka tracking numbers) are returned by various Pod methods, such as Pod.runQuickScript(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) and Pod.runMainLines(int, int). A Pod command's sequence number is useful for tracking activity when multiple applications are attempting to control a Pod.

Simple applications usually only use sequence numbers to determine if their Pod command has started and/or finished.

Returns:
the sequence number of the Pod command that caused the error
Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
Pod.isPodCmdStarted(int), Pod.isPodCmdFinished(int)

getErrorStartPos

public int getErrorStartPos()
Returns the starting position of the scripting error within the script.

Returns:
zero-based offset of the scripting error

getErrorEndPos

public int getErrorEndPos()
Returns the end position of the scripting error within the script.

Returns:
zero-based offset of the end of the scripting error

getErrorLine

public int getErrorLine()
Returns the line of the scripting error within the script.

Returns:
zero-based line of the scripting error

getErrorColumn

public int getErrorColumn()
Returns the column of the scripting error within the script.

Returns:
zero-based column of the scripting error

getErrorCode

public int getErrorCode()
Returns the error code associated with the scripting error.

As of this writing, the error code is not very useful. In the future, a table of error codes may provided, or this method may be removed altogether.

Returns:
the error code

getErrorDescription

public java.lang.String getErrorDescription()
Returns a description of the scripting error (if available).

Returns:
the error description

getErrorToken

public java.lang.String getErrorToken()
Returns the token associated with the scripting error.

Returns:
the error token

isUpdatable

public boolean isUpdatable()
Determines if this object's information can be updated by passing it to an info-updating method, such as Pod.getScriptingInfo(ScriptingInfo). By default, ScriptingInfo objects are updatable, but subclasses may override this method (and return false) in order to prevent updates.

Returns:
true if object is updatable; false otherwise
Since:
1.0.0
